sentences: Hommikul .. imestas teda väga ta unenägu.
..astusin läbi mõisa rohuaia välja, ilusat suvehommikut imestama.
context: The Estonian word 'teadsite' appears to be a form of the verb 'tundma' (to know/feel) in this context. In the dictionary definition, it's shown as part of a quote where someone exclaims "Kuidas te teadsite oodata?" which translates to "How did you know to wait?" or "How could you expect/wait?" used with surprise or astonishment. The word 'teadsite' in this context seems to be related to knowing or being aware of something that causes wonder or amazement.
